intro: Buchanania platyneura, commonly known as the white-barked tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, white bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
